item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, January 3, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. UK ICO response to Google's policy change on device fingerprinting (66 points | 33 comments)
2. Digital gardens people maintain outside the "Big Tech" walled gardens (159 points | 41 comments)
3. Gource: Software Version Control Visualization (12 points | 4 comments)

5. iTerm2 critical security release (563 points | 338 comments)
6. Zildjian, a 400-year-old cymbal-making company in Massachusetts (349 points | 167 comments)
7. JPL Horizons on-line solar system data and ephemeris computation service (29 points | 4 comments)
8. Advent of Code 2024 in pure SQL (335 points | 79 comments)
9. Laser mapping reveals oldest Amazonian cities, built 2500 years ago (19 points | 3 comments)
10. Optimizing Ruby's JSON, Part 4 (139 points | 17 comments)
11. Ask HN: How to learn marketing and sales as a solo entrepreneur? (188 points | 52 comments)
12. Shmøergh Hog – The making of a simple analog synth (106 points | 3 comments)
13. TinyStories: How Small Can Language Models Be and Still Speak Coherent English? (2023) (174 points | 80 comments)
14. Mars Exploration: How the CIA's Project Stargate Went to Mars [pdf] (17 points | 10 comments)

19. Diagnosing an Unusual WiFi Issue (2020) (214 points | 75 comments)
20. Be a property owner and not a renter on the internet (250 points | 154 comments)
21. Postgres UUIDv7 and per-back end monotonicity (196 points | 93 comments)
22. Rules for writing software tutorials (212 points | 45 comments)
23. Multispectral imaging through scattering media and around corners (14 points | discuss)
24. uBlock Origin GPL code being stolen by team behind honey browser extension (772 points | 349 comments)
25. I am rich and have no idea what to do (608 points | 986 comments)
26. What Is miniKanren? (212 points | 110 comments)
27. Building a Knowledge System That Enhances Rather Than Replaces Thought (103 points | 25 comments)
28. U.S. appeals court strikes down FCC's net neutrality rules (230 points | 200 comments)
29. Linux Context Switching Internals: Process State and Memory (152 points | 2 comments)
30. UpCodes (YC S17) is hiring remote recruiters to help make buildings cheaper ( | hide)
